Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This data analyst role sits within our Technology Insights Futures and Foresight (TIFF) unit. TIFF provides high quality, independent evidence to inform strategic decisions on science and technology and long- term issues. Our team is diverse, inclusive and focused on individual wellbeing. We are proud to support lots of different working patterns, locations and learning and development activity. We are a multidisciplinary team of analysts, data scientists, scientists, economists, and policy professionals.

Our Foresight programme brings scientific evidence and long-term thinking to policy and strategy development. We identify important, long-term, cross-cutting issues for government where we can offer a unique, futures-orientated perspective, and deliver science advice that is evidence-based and impactful. We work collaboratively with other government departments, academia and industry, bringing wide-ranging and expert views to bear on important strategic issues.

Our Technology Science Insights team analyses science and technology, to understand the UK's relative areas of strength and weakness in science and technology. The team uses all source evidence, data and expert engagement to produce advice to senior customers across government.

The post holder will work collaboratively to produce insights and reports for policy makers on long term strategic issues, science and technology. We work with a wide range of data and information sources including academic publication records, patents, business, financial and national security information. We work flexibly across projects and there will be opportunities to work with teams across GO Science, advising the Government Chief Scientific Adviser.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job id: 095074

Salary: £37,332 - £42,099 including London Weighting Allowance.

Business unit: King's Digital

Department: King's Digital.

Location: Strand Campus

Category: Professional & Support Services.




About us

Our mission is to provide transformative, high-quality digital education, so students can learn, wherever they are.




We collaborate with academics and professional services staff across the university, and with our external partners, to design, develop and deliver a wide range of educational programmes.




Our learners study with us from across the world, choosing when and where they study, working around their schedules.




We are a dynamic team with ambitious growth targets in a priority area of development for King’s. We proudly foster a supportive culture and community which prioritises both individual and collective wellbeing.




Employee support at King’s includes flexible working arrangements, paid maternity/shared parental leave, menopausal support, an active wellbeing programme, training and development opportunities and much more. All of our staff benefit from a generous pension contribution as well.




As part of hybrid working at King’s, all team members can work remotely for part of the week if they wish.




Join us as we open futures and unlock potential.




About the role

In this exciting new role within King's Digital, the Data Analyst will be supporting in driving the data strategy and operations of the University’s online programmes. Reporting to the Data Governance and Lead Analyst, the Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in producing regular and ad-hoc reports that deliver insights into management information, business intelligence, and statistical analysis. These reports will support key stakeholders across various teams and departments within the University.




The Data Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the data that underpins King’s Digital and its programmes, using tools like Power BI to enhance productivity and inform decision-making. This role involves data manipulation and interpretation to support student experience and online delivery optimisation and in refining and improving student data processes.




Additionally, the Data Analyst will ensure that reporting is seamlessly integrated with university processes, maintaining strong communication and coordination with central data reporting teams, data governance teams, academic faculties, admissions, and marketing. As the primary point of contact for data-related inquiries, the postholder will manage reporting outputs, uphold data security, and ensure compliance with data protection regulations. The role also involves providing training and guidance to report users, promoting self-service capabilities, and enhancing the data literacy of King's Digital staff. Through these efforts, the Data Analyst will contribute significantly to the overall King’s Digital Data Strategy.




This is a full-time post and you will be offered an indefinite contract.




Contact details: Wyman Jayarajah. wyman.jayarajah@kcl.ac.uk




Closing date: 25 September 2024.




To apply, please click “Apply Now”.

About us

Our mission is to provide transformative, high-quality digital education, so students can learn, wherever they are.


We collaborate with academics and professional services staff across the university, and with our external partners, to design, develop and deliver a wide range of educational programmes.


Our learners study with us from across the world, choosing when and where they study, working around their schedules.


We are a dynamic team with ambitious growth targets in a priority area of development for King’s. We proudly foster a supportive culture and community which prioritises both individual and collective wellbeing.


Employee support at King’s includes flexible working arrangements, paid maternity/shared parental leave, menopausal support, an active wellbeing programme, training and development opportunities and much more. All of our staff benefit from a generous pension contribution as well.


As part of hybrid working at King’s, all team members can work remotely for part of the week if they wish.


Join us as we open futures and unlock potential.


About the role

In this exciting new role within King's Digital, the Data Analyst will be supporting in driving the data strategy and operations of the University’s online programmes. Reporting to the Data Governance and Lead Analyst, the Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in producing regular and ad-hoc reports that deliver insights into management information, business intelligence, and statistical analysis. These reports will support key stakeholders across various teams and departments within the University.


The Data Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the data that underpins King’s Digital and its programmes, using tools like Power BI to enhance productivity and inform decision-making. This role involves data manipulation and interpretation to support student experience and online delivery optimisation and in refining and improving student data processes.


Additionally, the Data Analyst will ensure that reporting is seamlessly integrated with university processes, maintaining strong communication and coordination with central data reporting teams, data governance teams, academic faculties, admissions, and marketing. As the primary point of contact for data-related inquiries, the postholder will manage reporting outputs, uphold data security, and ensure compliance with data protection regulations. The role also involves providing training and guidance to report users, promoting self-service capabilities, and enhancing the data literacy of King's Digital staff. Through these efforts, the Data Analyst will contribute significantly to the overall King’s Digital Data Strategy.


This is a full-time post and you will be offered an indefinite contract.


Contact details: Wyman Jayarajah. wyman.jayarajah@kcl.ac.uk


Closing date: 25 September 2024.


To apply, please click “Apply Now”.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (JR100931)
Description:
At Clarion, our people are at the absolute heart of what we do. We're proud that our core values of PASSION, CARE, IMAGINATION, and TRUST define the way we carry out our work across all of our exhibitions and conferences.

If you share our values and want to be a part of a successful, dynamic, and creative global business then we want to hear from you.

The Opportunity:

Clarion Gaming Digital are a market-leading media and marketing services provider. We work hand in hand with our Clarion Events team, who organise the largest B2B Global Gaming event, ICE London.

Our leading digital media site, igamingbusiness.com, is the leading B2B website in the sector and we have exciting yet ambitious plans to scale our existing Gaming digital business model, and diversify into other digital media products within the B2B Gaming space.

We have spent the last year investing significantly in building out a fit for purpose operating model, including building a new team and technology stack. Now we are ready to take our growth to the next level, and are looking for committed and talented individuals to drive that journey.

Our team are aligned around a mission to become the number one growth partner for Gaming Companies Globally. We've made incredible progress against this mission and are excited for the forward opportunities!

The data analytics team is a new team with CGD that is core to gaining a better understanding of Clarion's Gaming customers and enabling revenue growth. The types of analytics work include customer segmentation, predictive modelling, marketing campaign reporting and campaign optimisation.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and deliver comprehensive reporting solutions to key business areas including commercial, marketing, and customer service departments using PowerBI and SQL
Maintain high standards of data accuracy and quality by performing rigorous data validation and error-checking processes
Oversee the usage and performance of reports and dashboards, ensuring they meet the needs of internal stakeholders and remain up-to-date
Conduct statistical analysis to uncover insights, trends, and patterns in data, providing actionable recommendations to improve business decisions
Learn and apply key data visualization techniques to create insightful and easy-to-understand reports for various stakeholders
Work with the team to establish and implement data quality measurement and reporting frameworks to ensure data integrity across all reporting solutions
Continuously seek out new technologies and methodologies to innovate and optimize data management processes
Support the implementation of automation in reporting solutions to support the self-service adoption of analytics, enhancing efficiency and scalability



Requirements

Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours:


Previous experience with PowerBI is essential for this position, along with experience in SQL, Excel and a background with advanced data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., Python, R, Apache Spark)
The successful candidate will ideally have a digital background (digital media/tech/advertising etc) as an understanding of the industry is necessary for the position.
Experience working with multiple business functions (e.g. sales, marketing, content, product teams) to deliver value from data analytics
A background within data analytics environment with a strong emphasis on customer and marketing related analytics
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Innovative thinking with a proactive approach to identifying and solving data management challenges.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
Knowledge of data governance principles and practices
Ability to manage workload and prioritise accordingly.
A solid understanding of relevant data standards and regulations (HIPAA, GDPR, etc.)



About Clarion Events

Clarion Events is one of the world's leading event organisers, producing and delivering innovative and market-leading events since 1947. (https://clarionevents.com/welcome)

Clarion Events embrace diversity and equal opportunities in all that we do. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Clarion is private equity backed and owned by Blackstone. Blackstone is one of the world's leading global investment funds, investing capital for the long term in order to build successful, resilient businesses. (https://www.blackstone.com/)

Our purpose is to deliver exceptional customer outcomes and experiences, by making every connection count.

Our vision is we want every one of our products to be a market leader in customer satisfaction and delight.

Benefits


25 days' holiday plus bank holidays
End of year wellbeing shutdown (closed for the last week of the year)
Celebration day off (e.g. birthday, Diwali, Eid, etc)
Summer Hours in August (3pm finish on Fridays)
Helping Our World (HOW) Days - one paid day per quarter to carry out charity work
Pension Scheme
Private Medical Insurance
Health Cash Plan
Wellbeing Library (MYNDUP)
Mentoring Programme
Subsidised Café
Season Ticket Loan
Cycle to Work Schemes
Free on-site gym and shower facilities
Free eyesight tests
Free flu vaccination - offered on site once a year for all employees
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a data scientist/analyst to join our small and growing team to continue building our data processes and help build our product further. As part of the data team at elm you can expect to own large parts of the data product, learn fast and grow as elm does, and work directly with large customers directly on their most exciting opportunities.

What you’ll do:


Support with internal data processes and take the lead on ensuring all data connections are live and active
Develop new data features and improve existing ones to help FMCG brands harness their data
Develop internal tools and processes to ensure data infrastructure is working to its utmost capability
Work with extensive datasets in the retail sector to create and implement data science solutions for the industry
Help users solve issues and respond to their feedback
Work alongside our engineering, product, and sales teams to develop and implement data products


Requirements

About you:


You have at least 1 year experience working as a data analyst or scientist
You’re very well-versed in SQL and Python
You have experience working with data systems and architecture such as AWS, DBT, or similar
You're confident both getting stuck in with data processes and tasks but also thinking strategically about how data can help drive businesses forward
You care about success and growing professionally
You’re well organised and a strong communicator


Benefits

What we can offer you:


Starting salary of £30-35k
Share options: the chance to own a part of elm
Flexible working. We trust you to do your job well at times that suit you (hours and location)
Ownership: the chance to build a product from scratch, define elm’s future, and reap the rewards when we succeed
28 days holiday (plus bank holidays)


Note: we're a London based company but are ~90% remote (we like to try meet up regularly for in person sessions). The ideal candidate will be within 1 hour of the UK timezone.

A Little About The Application Process

To manage your expectations, the following is the 5 main steps of our application process:


Application review
Phone/zoom interview
Practical exercise (max 2-3 hours of your own time)
Further team interviews
Final discussion / offer


We want to work with great people who care

If you’re not sure you match the criteria but you want to be a part of our mission and you like the sound of jumping in at ground level, we want to hear from you. We also believe that diverse teams make better things, so we’d especially like to hear from you if you come from a background that’s traditionally underrepresented in tech.
Show more
HTML:
We’re looking for a data scientist/analyst to join our small and growing team to continue building our data processes and help build our product further. As part of the data team at elm you can expect to own large parts of the data product, learn fast and grow as elm does, and work directly with large customers directly on their most exciting opportunities.

What you’ll do:

  • Support with internal data processes and take the lead on ensuring all data connections are live and active
  • Develop new data features and improve existing ones to help FMCG brands harness their data
  • Develop internal tools and processes to ensure data infrastructure is working to its utmost capability
  • Work with extensive datasets in the retail sector to create and implement data science solutions for the industry
  • Help users solve issues and respond to their feedback
  • Work alongside our engineering, product, and sales teams to develop and implement data products

Requirements

About you:

  • You have at least 1 year experience working as a data analyst or scientist
  • You’re very well-versed in SQL and Python
  • You have experience working with data systems and architecture such as AWS, DBT, or similar
  • You're confident both getting stuck in with data processes and tasks but also thinking strategically about how data can help drive businesses forward
  • You care about success and growing professionally
  • You’re well organised and a strong communicator

Benefits

What we can offer you:

  • Starting salary of £30-35k
  • Share options: the chance to own a part of elm
  • Flexible working. We trust you to do your job well at times that suit you (hours and location)

Title: Junior Insight Analyst - Contract
Description:
Junior Insight Executive

6-Month Fixed Term Contract | £30,000 Salary | Hybrid Working (London)




Salt is working with one of the UK's leading social media agencies, renowned for creating impactful, data-driven campaigns for some of the biggest brands in the world. We're seeking a passionate and driven Junior Insight Executive to join on an initial 6-month fixed-term contract, with the opportunity to transition into a permanent role.




As a Junior Insight Executive, you will be at the heart of our data and insights team, transforming social listening data into powerful stories that drive real impact for clients. Your passion for turning complex data into clear, actionable recommendations will be key in helping clients make informed decisions and shape their digital strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Social Listening & Analysis: Use social listening tools to monitor conversations, trends, and sentiment around key topics and brands.
Data Storytelling: Transform data insights into compelling, easy-to-understand stories that inform and engage stakeholders.
Reporting & Insights: Create reports that provide actionable recommendations based on your analysis, contributing to campaign success and strategy refinement.
Collaboration: Work closely with the wider insights and account teams to ensure data-driven insights align with overall campaign objectives.
Trend Spotting: Stay ahead of digital trends and identify opportunities for our clients to stay at the forefront of their industries.




About you:

A natural problem-solver with a strong ability to interpret and analyse data
A deep interest in social media platforms and digital trends, and how they can influence brand strategy.
Ability to translate data into clear, insightful stories that inspire action
Ideally experience or familiarity with social listening tools (e.g., Brandwatch, Sprout Social, Talkwalker)
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an eye for detail and clarity.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Tableau Specialist)

Location: London (Hybrid - 3 days in office)

Type: Contract (Outside IR35)

Rate: £650/day




A leading commodities trading firm is seeking an experienced Data Analyst with advanced Tableau skills and a strong background in energy trading to join their dynamic London-based team. This is a contract role, offering a competitive rate of £650/day, outside IR35, with the opportunity to work 3 days a week from the office.




Key Responsibilities:

Leverage Tableau to design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards, providing valuable insights to traders and senior stakeholders.
Analyze and interpret large datasets to inform trading strategies, risk management, and decision-making processes.
Collaborate closely with trading, risk, and IT teams to ensure the accurate flow and visualization of data.
Provide support for ad hoc data analysis requests and reporting needs specific to the energy trading domain.




Key Requirements:

Strong proficiency in Tableau with a proven track record of developing complex dashboards (Tableau certification preferred).
Experience in the commodities trading sector, with specific domain knowledge in energy trading.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to work with large datasets and create actionable insights.
Solid understanding of trading systems, market data, and commodities risk management.
Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure, fast-paced trading environment.
Hybrid role: Must be available to work from the London office 3 days a week.




Additional Information:

Contract: Initial 6 months with potential for extension.
Rate: £650/day (Outside IR35).




This is an excellent opportunity to work with a market leader in the commodities trading space, leveraging your data skills and industry experience to make a tangible impact.

If you have a strong Tableau background and experience in energy trading, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Provide state of the art operational data expertise to support investment teams and build strong connections with business stakeholders.

Secure daily data production tasks; delivering work of high quality. Daily tasks are structured into 3 groups forming the rota and you will be exposed to all shifts over time. Responsibilities include loading datasets, verifying overnight batches, checking the quality of accruals etc. These are designed to ensure data quality and consistency across systems.

Manage instruments and portfolios data exceptions to secure core investment data (securities statics, classifiers, pricing, analytics, valuations and P&L) as part of the day to day production:

Set up securities accurately and quickly as per the fund manager or traders' request so orders can be placed for trading; manage any exceptions when required.

Resolve issues/exceptions in a timely manner and escalate to management as required.

Actively provide updates to other team members, as well as internal stakeholders.

Perform daily data quality checks on Securities.

Continually improve and develop procedures/processes as the business advances by presenting findings and recommendations to the team.

Participate in the implementation of data management processes and the rollout of our Enterprise Data Management (EDM) solution within an agile framework.

Active involvement in Data and transversal Operations projects. Engage with stakeholders to understand and frame business issues, investigate and communicate findings and solutions to management.

Pro-actively collaborate with the Data team based in Singapore and manage the daily handover.

Skills:

Undergraduate degree in either Finance or Sciences.

Minimum 2-3 years' experience in a similar role within asset management, investment banking or financial vendors.

Strong knowledge of securities static data. An understanding of pricing, analytics and portfolio valuation is beneficial (ETD, OTC, Alternative Assets).

Good knowledge of investment operations systems and data providers, i.e. Bloomberg, Markit, Simcorp, Charles River, NeoXam. Knowledge of JIRA and Tableau beneficial.

Good communication skills, culture of service excellence, and a solution-oriented team player, you will be comfortable adapting to a shift/rota pattern.

Ability to establish and develop effective business engagement relationships with transversal stakeholders.

You will be self-motivated, curious, and detail-oriented. You will have a proactive approach to problem solving as well as being disciplined, rigorous and forward thinking with a flexible attitude and business-oriented sense of priorities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

We are currently looking for a Client Data Associate to join ACA Mirabella’s Data and Implementations Team. This person will assist the day-to-day clients’ data onboarding, supporting the client implementation team with data quality issues and helping to identify data inconsistencies.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Client Data Associate to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate must be a team player and be able to collaborate effectively with other stakeholders to support data management and implementation. Self initiative to learn in a challenging, fast-paced and developing regulatory environment is an asset.

The position requires strong analytical skills, and a passion for data integrity and quality. Core responsibilities involve the seamless integration and management of client data obtained from various external systems into our internal control framework.

What you’ll do:



Assist in the day-to-day clients’ data onboarding process, including ongoing collaboration with departments and updating internal documentation (FAQs, Data Samples, Data Specs, etc)
Assist in recognising potential data inconsistencies and reconcile appropriately to preserve data integrity.
Assist identifying data quality issues through analysis and work with departments to resolve them.
Assist client implementation team with data mapping and help resolve any data inconsistency issues detected.
Work closely with internal teams to address data quality issues and enhance data workflows.
Ensure timely and accurate response to internal and external data requests. Maintain detailed documentation of data onboarding processes, client data specifications, and data mappings.
Performs any other related duties as required or assigned.


Knowledge and Skills Required:



Bachelor's degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer or Data Science, or a related field.
1-2 years of relevant work experience, working with large data sets preferably in the financial services sector.
Proficiency in Excel – pivot tables, lookups, etc.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to work with personnel at all levels.
Able to work independently and be resourceful, with excellent time management skills.
Able to work independently and be resourceful, with excellent time management skills.


Desirable skills/experience:



Data analytics.
Disclosure reporting.
Surveillance systems implementation.
Power BI/Tableau.
SQL/Python .


What working at ACA offers:

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options as well as a flexible work environment. You’ll also be granted time off for designated ACA Paid Holidays, Summer Fridays, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. We also offer unique benefits such as Student Debt Forgiveness and Pet Insurance.

About Mirabella:

Established in 2004, ACA Mirabella provides regulated financial services to the discretionary management and advisory sectors and manages approximately $30bn in assets.

ACA Mirabella, part of the ACA Group, offers a high-quality and flexible regulatory hosting platform in the UK and continental Europe (via Malta). ACA Mirabella has helped over two hundred firms undertake regulated activities under its umbrella, while allowing them to retain their own brand identity and control.

About ACA:

ACA Group is the leading governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) advisor in financial services. We empower our clients to reimagine GRC and protect and grow their business. Our innovative approach integrates consulting, managed services, and our ComplianceAlpha® technology platform with the specialized expertise of former regulators and practitioners and our deep understanding of the global regulatory landscape.

What we commit to:

ACA is firmly committed to a policy of non-discrimination, which applies to recruiting, hiring, placement, promotions, training, discipline, terminations, layoffs, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation and all other terms and conditions of employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a financial services organisation based in Southwest London are looking for an experienced SQL Data Analyst with Business Intelligence experience to join their growing team.




Day to Day Responsibilities:

Engage with stakeholders to understand business reporting needs and present findings meaningfully.
Perform business analysis to build business reports and dashboards.
Write requirements specifications for reports and dashboards.
Keep existing reports refreshed and up-to-date.
Implement Power BI reporting from scratch, making it accessible company-wide.
Perform robust quality assurance on reports to ensure accuracy and alignment with stakeholder expectations.
Present and train users on using reports/dashboards, ensuring they understand the data.
Monitor, manage, and improve the robustness of daily data warehouse data loads.
Write technical and user documentation to support the BI team in developing and maintaining the data warehouse.
Manage code, version, and release control.




Must Haves:

At least 3 years of experience with data warehouse reporting systems using Power BI.
Solid MSSQL experience (2016 or above), T-SQL, and stored procedures.
Analytical mindset with experience in data modeling and data mining.
Excellent presentation skills and relevant work experience in business analysis.







Nice to Haves:

Experience with MSSQL Tabular model cubes / DAX language.
Exposure to the Atlassian suite.
Good verbal communication skills.
Experience in the financial industry.
Understanding of GDPR.
Working knowledge of Git/Bitbucket.







Package:

£40,000 - £60,000 basic salary
Bonus opportunity
Hybrid working
+ many other excellent benefits

Show more

  • Understanding of GDPR.

  • Bonus opportunity
  • Hybrid working
  • + many other excellent benefits

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst - Risk
Description:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our clients Risk Models and Data team within the 2nd Line of Defence (2LOD). This is an exciting opportunity to support key data analysis and governance initiatives while contributing to the wider risk management function.




Key Responsibilities:

Run regular production of Management Information (MI) reports and handle ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Assist in the development of both ad-hoc and regular management reporting through robust data analysis.
Enhance the efficiency of MI production processes.
Support data quality resolution and data lineage activities within the team.
Contribute to building a strong data governance and data quality framework within the risk function.
Ensure compliance with the bank's Risk Management framework and escalate concerns when necessary.




What We’re Looking For:

Minimum 1 year of experience working with data analysis in financial services.
Degree educated (or equivalent), preferably in a STEM subject.
Intermediate knowledge of SAS and SQL, with a passion for further development.
Understanding of risk/financial terminology with a desire to expand this knowledge.
Proficient in MS Excel, including formulas and pivot tables; knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive, collaborative approach.




**unfortunately, no sponsorship is available for this position**

Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a data scientist/analyst to join our small and growing team to continue building our data processes and help build our product further. As part of the data team at elm you can expect to own large parts of the data product, learn fast and grow as elm does, and work directly with large customers directly on their most exciting opportunities.

What you’ll do:


Support with internal data processes and take the lead on ensuring all data connections are live and active
Develop new data features and improve existing ones to help FMCG brands harness their data
Develop internal tools and processes to ensure data infrastructure is working to its utmost capability
Work with extensive datasets in the retail sector to create and implement data science solutions for the industry
Help users solve issues and respond to their feedback
Work alongside our engineering, product, and sales teams to develop and implement data products


Requirements

About you:


You have at least 1 year experience working as a data analyst or scientist
You’re very well-versed in SQL and Python
You have experience working with data systems and architecture such as AWS, DBT, or similar
You're confident both getting stuck in with data processes and tasks but also thinking strategically about how data can help drive businesses forward
You care about success and growing professionally
You’re well organised and a strong communicator


Benefits

What we can offer you:


Starting salary of £30-35k
Share options: the chance to own a part of elm
Flexible working. We trust you to do your job well at times that suit you (hours and location)
Ownership: the chance to build a product from scratch, define elm’s future, and reap the rewards when we succeed
28 days holiday (plus bank holidays)


Note: we're a London based company but are ~90% remote (we like to try meet up regularly for in person sessions). The ideal candidate will be within 1 hour of the UK timezone.

A Little About The Application Process

To manage your expectations, the following is the 5 main steps of our application process:


Application review
Phone/zoom interview
Practical exercise (max 2-3 hours of your own time)
Further team interviews
Final discussion / offer


We want to work with great people who care

If you’re not sure you match the criteria but you want to be a part of our mission and you like the sound of jumping in at ground level, we want to hear from you. We also believe that diverse teams make better things, so we’d especially like to hear from you if you come from a background that’s traditionally underrepresented in tech.
Show more

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Inspired Education is the leading global group of premium schools, with a portfolio of over 116 premium private schools spanning six continents which utilise proven educational practices from every corner of the globe, ensuring over 90,000 students receive a world-class learning experience from Kindergarten to Year 13.

Founded in 2013 by Nadim M. Nsouli, Inspired is backed by investors such as Stonepeak, GIC, TA Associates, and the Oppenheimer and Mansour family offices. The Group is experiencing 20% per annum growth through acquisition, greenfield site expansion, and the development of existing schools within its portfolio. In 2023, Inspired was recognised by Beauhurst as one of the UK's top 10 highest-value private companies.

ROLE SUMMARY:

Inspired is seeking to appoint a Junior Data Analyst to join us as soon as possible on a permanent basis.

“Inspiring Academic Excellence Across 5 Continents”

A definitive statement of excellence in private education, Inspired is a co-educational, non- denominational, independent school group designed to inspire students to achieve their maximum potential in a nurturing, progressive academic environment from ages 3 months to 18 yrs.

Inspired offers a fresh and contemporary approach to education by re-evaluating traditional teaching methods and curriculums, and creating a more dynamic, relevant and powerful model reflecting current attitudes. We nurture the unique individuality, talent and self-assurance of each student, equipping them to take on the world with the skills and confidence to ensure success.

Our current portfolio of 110+ schools currently operate across Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa, the Middle East and Latin America, with quick ongoing expansion foreseen. The group has grown exponentially since its founding 10 years ago and offers a unique opportunity to join a connected global community obsessed with a dedication to excellence.

We take great care when selecting new colleagues to join Inspired Education and hand pick every single role. We believe true excellence in education is only achieved through an inspiring and passionate team with whom are dedicated to supporting our schools to recruit and retain students by sustaining engaging and inspiring learning environments through our 3 pillars of: Performing and Creative Arts; Academics and Sport.

Professionalism, responsive teaching, specialist knowledge, strong planning, excellent qualifications, and an outstanding personal reputation, are just few of the core requirements we look for when recruiting Inspired teaching staff.

For more information about us, please visit Inspired Schools - Premium Private Education (inspirededu.com)

The Role/Purpose

Working alongside our Head of Data & Analytics, you will be a key member of the data team focused on delivering and enhancing the data solutions across our organisation. You will be confident with querying data using SQL to investigate and resolve our data challenges.

You will identify opportunities to drive incremental revenue which impacts the customer journey and work on improving measurement and reporting across all enrolment and marketing functions. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, results-oriented individual, with strong analytical aptitude and problem-solving skills to join our global team.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Qualifications & Technical Skills


A proven track record of querying & resolving data inaccuracies and challenges using SQL & T-SQL including joins, sub-selects & aggregation
Strong understanding of relational database concepts & data normalisation
Knowledge of PowerBI dashboard building and DAX is a bonus
Strong time management skills to ensure effective on time delivery of tasks


Data Analysis & Management


Undertake data analysis to maintain accurate data in all school systems, enabling responsive decision-making through the enrolment pipeline, recruitment events and accurate forecasting during annual planning
Support the Data, Admissions and Finance teams where needed to ensure data is defined, structured and accessible in a way that provides actionable insights to stakeholders
Partner with our data engineers to identify and solve data quality issues, database cleansing, segmentation, enrichment, and acquisition initiatives


Performance Marketing & Automation


Partner with the global customer experience team, CRM, and marketing teams, to ensure accuracy of data across our acquisition funnels
Evolve the web, social, media, and analytics work, developing areas such as journey analytics, digital effectiveness, and attribution


Stakeholder communication


Work in partnership with the finance, admissions, marketing and local teams to query and resolve data challenges and initiatives
Support admissions teams, ensuring they have the knowledge, training, and expertise to deliver accurate and effective enrolment reports


THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:


Highly organised with strong attention to detail, ensuring clarity and accuracy
Analytical and data driven thinker
Strong time-management skills with ability to manage competing priorities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills
Creativity, flexibility, and adaptability
Confident problem solver
Professional demeanor


Key Relationships:

Internal:


Engineering team
CRM team
Regional marketing teams
Finance
Digital team


External


Analytics agency
Technology providers


Visit our careers site for more information; https://jobs.inspirededu.com
Show more

  • Highly organised with strong attention to detail, ensuring clarity and accuracy
  • Analytical and data driven thinker
  • Strong time-management skills with ability to manage competing priorities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills
  • Creativity, flexibility, and adaptability
  • Confident problem solver
  • Professional demeanor

Key Relationships:

Internal:

  • Engineering team
  • CRM team
  • Regional marketing teams
  • Finance
  • Digital team

External

  • Analytics agency
  • Technology providers

Visit our careers site for more information; https://jobs.inspirededu.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity at a progressive and successful media agency where you will provide support to the ARMLabs team and media planning and buying teams at All Response Media by way of data wrangling, analysis and basic econometrics. 

You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models. 

This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science.

A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.

About The Company

All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam

We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.

We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.

We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
Test data for completeness and correctness
Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards
Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
Provide web tag data to ARM teams
Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
Compile and report on competitor insights
Run simple econometric regressions in R
Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
Assist with finding innovative ways to systemise and streamline processes 


Requirements


BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
Basic data manipulation skills in Excel/R (or Python)
Basic timeseries econometric regressions experience (Python/R/etc.)
Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics.
Good communication skills
Good story telling with data skills
MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
Media experience (preferred)
Eligible to work in the UK


Benefits


Competitive salary and bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
Progression and development


Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.
Show more

  • MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)

  • Eligible to work in the UK

  • Competitive salary and bonus
  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
  • Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
  • Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
  • Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
  • Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
  • Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection

  • Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
  • Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
  • Progression and development

Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Camino Search are delighted to be partnered with a hyper growth PE backed technology business that are scaling. The business has a solid market foundation, has international presence and has been through multiple rounds of funding. They boast an innovative, market-leading product with multiple revenue streams. They now require advanced CRM analytics to develop and drive strategic initiatives as they continue to grow towards a potential exit.




Responsibilities:

Evaluate and Iterate: Assess test results to refine our CRM strategies and ensure continuous optimization.
Support the Head of CRM: Provide data-driven insights to help the Head of CRM understand performance and make informed decisions.
Collaborate with Data Engineering: Work with the data engineering team to model CRM data accurately and develop reports to show CRM’s impact on the business.
Analyze Customer Data: Explore unstructured data to find insights about our customers, guiding communication strategies for different user segments.
Design and Execute Tests: Create and run A/B and multivariate tests based on these insights to improve our approach.




Requirements:

4+ years experience in a similar role focusing on product / marketing analytics.
Experience within a high growth, scaling company.
Advanced SQL skills with the ability to manipulate large data sets.
Experience with BI and data modelling tools (preferable)

Show more
