Title: Data Analyst - GCP
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

•Hands on and at good years work experience working with Google Cloud Services like Big Query, Dataflow, Data Proc, Cloud Functions, Cloud Data Fusion, Cloud Composer etc.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design

•Developing data ingestion framework for different sources

•Strong migration experience of Hadoop cluster to Google Cloud

•Ability to suggest optimal architectural solution on GCP to customer

•Strong knowledge in SQL, Java\Python

•Certified as Professional Data Engineer - GCP.

•Good Communication skill.

•Exposure to Hadoop ecosystem

•Prior working experience as Data Analyst or similar project.

•GCP knowledge and tools like Tableau / BI / Looker will be addition to this Role.

•Managing Data Analyst role, Compare data and match against the requirement.

•Analyzing various source of data and compare with target data.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resource.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LeverageTek is actively seeking a Data Specialist for a 3-month contract with its Ottawa-based customer.




Work Location

Remote




Key Tasks

Liaise with internal Technology project teams and stakeholders to enable and ensure adherence to data standards, data quality, data planning, data governance, data security
Provide leadership to project teams and stakeholders to ensure an understanding of the organization's data policies, data quality standards, data governance, data processes
With project teams and stakeholders, identify project data needs, data risks
Conduct data profiling and assessment based on data quality rules
Conduct analysis of data to ensure compliance with standards and governance
Conduct data profiling, identify and develop metadata and data models
Provide knowledge transfer to project teams and stakeholders regarding best practices and adherence to the organizations’ data governance and quality standards
Provide ongoing reporting to the organization’s Data and Information Management team regarding project data status, attending regular meetings as required




Key Qualifications

6+ years experience specializing in data planning, data analysis, data quality, data governance, data security, data risk management
Strong expertise in Data Management and Data Governance
Experience in data profiling, data modeling, metadata, data processes




Key Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or in a related field
Experience providing hands-on knowledge transfer to project teams
Strong team collaboration and leadership skills
Excellent communication skills (writing/verbal)
Experience writing and presenting reports to key stakeholders
Passion, diligence, analytical, detail-oriented
Experience with Agile principles and the Scrum Framework




Assets

Experience with the use of data modeling tools (Erwin, Collibra or other)
Experience with Data Quality tools




About LeverageTek IT Solutions

Thank you for taking the time to apply! Since our company’s inception in March 2003, LeverageTek IT Solutions has worked resolutely to become one of the industry’s most recognized and trusted suppliers of technology staffing and business consulting services. With hundreds of successful engagements to our credit with many of Canada’s leading public and private sector organizations, we are the experts in identifying, deploying, and supporting IT and business talent on a contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent basis. We work with customers across all sectors including academia, aerospace, aviation, finance, government, health care, high tech, military, not-for-profit, and more.

Our responsive service and ability to deliver the right fit, on time and within budget, typically leads to repeat engagements and a long-standing relationship.

Accessibility accommodations are available upon request.

  • Provide knowledge transfer to project teams and stakeholders regarding best practices and adherence to the organizations’ data governance and quality standards
  • Provide ongoing reporting to the organization’s Data and Information Management team regarding project data status, attending regular meetings as required


Key Qualifications

  • 6+ years experience specializing in data planning, data analysis, data quality, data governance, data security, data risk management
  • Strong expertise in Data Management and Data Governance
  • Experience in data profiling, data modeling, metadata, data processes


Key Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or in a related field
  • Experience providing hands-on knowledge transfer to project teams
  • Strong team collaboration and leadership skills
  • Excellent communication skills (writing/verbal)
  • Experience writing and presenting reports to key stakeholders
  • Passion, diligence, analytical, detail-oriented
  • Experience with Agile principles and the Scrum Framework


Assets

  • Experience with the use of data modeling tools (Erwin, Collibra or other)
  • Experience with Data Quality tools


About LeverageTek IT Solutions

Thank you for taking the time to apply! Since our company’s inception in March 2003, LeverageTek IT Solutions has worked resolutely to become one of the industry’s most recognized and trusted suppliers of technology staffing and business consulting services. With hundreds of successful engagements to our credit with many of Canada’s leading public and private sector organizations, we are the experts in identifying, deploying, and supporting IT and business talent on a contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent basis. We work with customers across all sectors including academia, aerospace, aviation, finance, government, health care, high tech, military, not-for-profit, and more.

Our responsive service and ability to deliver the right fit, on time and within budget, typically leads to repeat engagements and a long-standing relationship.

Accessibility accommodations are available upon request.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Minute Media is a global technology and content company specializing in sports and culture. Minute Media’s proprietary tech platform enables the creation, distribution and monetization of digital content experiences. They own and operate leading sports content brands, including Sports Illustrated , Sports Illustrated Swimsuit , The Players' Tribune , FanSided , Mental Floss and 90min , while also providing sports highlight rights through Minute Media’s most recent technology acquisition of STN Video . The company reaches 200M monthly users, powering 1,500+ content creators and 400+ distribution partners across 14 global markets in 10 languages. They also reach a robust print subscriber base through the publication of Sports Illustrated, Sports Illustrated Swim and Sports Illustrated Kids magazines.

We're hiring a Senior Data Analyst to lead the analysis and performance reporting for our publishing partners to provide actionable insights to both internal and external stakeholders. We seek a collaborative, efficient, and analytical person to join our data team. Working cross collaboratively, you will translate data into insights to support key business decisions


Collaborate closely with external publishers to gather data, monitor KPIs, and ensure alignment with project goals and expectations.
Develop detailed reports and dashboards that showcase performance metrics, trends, and recommendations for optimizing media campaigns.
Conduct data-driven analysis to assess the effectiveness of publishing partners projects and identify opportunities for improvement in collaboration with external partners.
Work with the product and technical teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources and proper tracking of metrics across multiple platforms.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership, external clients, and stakeholders to support business decisions.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, best practices, automation, and competitor strategies, particularly in the media and publishing sector.


Where You’ll Be

Based in New York?


We follow a hybrid approach to give you more options!
Most days you will have the flexibility to work remotely or from the office, whichever you choose
The BI & Data team works from the office 1-2 days a week for collaboration


Based in Toronto?


You will work primarily from home with the option to work from our Industrious location from time to time


The expected salary range for this position is between $75,000 and $95,000. Actual pay will be determined based on skills, experience, and location. The benefits available for this position (if located in New York) include flexible vacation policy, 15 paid holidays, paid parental leave, health insurance, and 401(k) retirement plan.

The benefits available for this position (if located in Toronto) include unlimited vacation policy, paid holidays, parental leave top-up, 100% employer paid health insurance from Day 1, and opportunities for ongoing growth and development.

Requirements


4+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or performance reporting, ideally within digital media, publishing, or ad tech industries.
Proficiency in analytics tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, etc.) and experience working with large datasets to extract insights. Proficiency in Python is also desired.
Knowledge of digital advertising, media metrics, and campaign performance indicators which is typically associated with prior experience in ad tech ecosystems, including programmatic advertising and media partnerships.
Proven ability to collaborate with external and internal stakeholders, manage relationships, and align goals to ensure mutual success.
Excellent communication skills, with experience in presenting complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders and external partners.
Ability to work independently while managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to translate raw data into meaningful insights that drive business outcomes.


Not sure that you're 100% qualified but are up for the challenge? We want you to apply!

Minute Media is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Minute Media participates in E-Verify.

Check the URL and email address of any correspondence with Minute Media. If it is not from @ minutemedia.com , treat it as fraudulent. To learn how to protect yourself from recruitment fraud click here .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capco - L'avenir. Aujourd'hui.




Capco est un lieu de travail nettement et positivement différent. Bien plus que des consultants, nous sommes des participants actifs au sein de l'industrie mondiale des services financiers. Nos professionnels passionnés des affaires et de la technologie bénéficient d'un environnement unique où ils sont activement encouragés à mettre en œuvre l'intelligence, l'innovation, l'expérience et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous engageons à soutenir pleinement nos clients de classe mondiale dans leur réponse aux défis et aux opportunités dans les domaines suivants : Banque et paiements, marchés des capitaux, assurance, gestion de patrimoine et d'actifs et énergie. Découvrez Capco par vous-même sur capco.com.




A propos du poste




Les responsabilités

Travailler avec l'architecte de données et d'autres planificateurs pour évaluer les capacités actuelles et identifier les exigences de haut niveau en matière de données.
Assister l'architecte stratégique, l'architecte métier, l'architecte des données, le responsable des données et le propriétaire des données dans la définition de la stratégie de gestion des données et de l'architecture des données.
Effectuer des analyses de données complexes pour étayer les décisions en matière de gestion des données.

Participer à l'identification et à la proposition de solutions de gestion des données.

Collaborer avec le client, les utilisateurs, l'architecte d'application, l'architecte technique, l'architecte de données, le modélisateur de données, les analystes commerciaux et les concepteurs d'applications pour définir les exigences en matière de qualité et de profilage des données

Obtenir des échantillons de données ou l'accès aux sources de données à profiler.
Configurer et finaliser l'outil de profilage des données pour les activités de profilage des données.
Exécuter les activités de profilage des données.
Examiner les rapports et les résultats du profilage des données afin d'identifier les domaines de préoccupation.
Analyser les problèmes de qualité des données identifiés par rapport au système source et aux capacités existantes en matière de qualité des données afin de confirmer la source du problème de qualité des données.
Examiner les résultats du profilage des données avec les parties prenantes.




Montrez-nous ce que vous avez

Compréhension des processus et des principes relatifs aux données
Capacité à analyser et à concevoir des données et des processus de données
Capacité à développer les exigences du produit sur la base des informations recueillies par l'analyse des données et des solutions de données
Compréhension de l'architecture technologique existante
Connaissance des pratiques commerciales et des processus techniques dont ils sont responsables
Capacité à comprendre les besoins des entreprises
Capacité à évaluer les changements de données en fonction de leur impact sur la technologie
Crédibilité au sein de l'entreprise
Capacité à trouver un équilibre entre les besoins de l'entreprise et les capacités des technologies de l'information
Connaissance des règles de gestion et de données utilisées pour alimenter les données
Excellente vision des processus
Excellentes compétences en matière d'analyse des causes profondes
Communicateur efficace - capable de présenter le contenu et d'obtenir l'adhésion.
Capacité à vérifier l'exhaustivité et la qualité des produits livrables dans le cadre d'un projet, ainsi que le respect des normes établies pour ce dernier.
L'expérience professionnelle est importante. Mais il est primordial que vous partagiez notre conviction que l'innovation perturbatrice permet aux clients de prendre de l'avance sur un marché difficile. Dès le premier jour, votre mission principale sera de percevoir de nouvelles et meilleures façons de faire les choses afin de donner un avantage à vos clients.




Passez à l'étape suivante

Nous avons :

L'accès à des talents spécialisés dans le secteur à l'échelle mondiale
La capacité de tirer parti des meilleurs produits et solutions innovants pour les architectures complexes et les transformations à grande échelle.
Une couverture géographique élargie du marché mondial
La possibilité de capitaliser sur notre empreinte client et notre expertise approfondie dans les domaines des services financiers et de l'énergie.




Pour plus d'informations sur Capco, visitez le site www.Capco.com.

Capco est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l'égalité des chances. Nous évaluons les candidats qualifiés sans tenir compte de la race, de la couleur, de la religion, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité sexuelle, de l'état civil, des informations génétiques, de l'origine nationale, du handicap, du statut d'ancien combattant et d'autres caractéristiques protégées.




Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We ware dedicated to fully supporting our world class clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking & Payments, Capital Markets, Insurance, Wealth & Asset Management and Energy . Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com.




About the Role

Responsibilities

Work with the data architect and other planners to assess current capabilities and identify high-level data requirements.
Assist the strategy architect, business architect, data architect, data steward, and data owner in defining the data management strategy and data architecture.
Perform complex data analysis to support data management decisions.
Participate in identifying and proposing data management solutions.
Work with the customer, users, application architect, technical architect, data architect, data modeler, business analysts, and application designers to define the data quality and profiling requirements.
Procure sample data sets or access to data sources to be profiled.
Configure and finalize the data profiling tool for data profiling activities.
Execute data profiling activities.
Review the data profiling reports and outcomes to identify areas of concern.
Analyze identified data quality issues against source system and existing data quality capabilities to confirm the source of the data quality issue.
Review the outcomes of data profiling with stakeholders.




Show Us What You’ve Got

Understanding of data processes and principles
Ability to analyze and design data and data processes
Ability to develop product requirements based on input gathered through analysis of data and data solutions
Understanding of existing technology architecture
Knowledge of the business practices and technical processes for which they are responsible
Ability to understand business requirements
Ability to assess data changes for technology impacts
Credible within the business
Able to balance business needs with IT capabilities
Knowledge of business and data rules used to populate data
Strong process viewpoint
Excellent root cause analysis skills
Effective communicator - able to present content and gain buy-in
Ability to review project deliverables for completeness and quality, and compliance with established project standards
Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From day one, your key mission will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an advantage.







For more information about Capco, visit www.Capco.com.

Capco is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our clients team located in Edmonton, Alberta. The role involves working closely with a cross-functional team in the financial industry, specifically focusing on ETL processes. This Data Analyst contract opportunity is offered with an initial term of 4-months with potential to extend.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and implement ETL processes to extract data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and flat files
Apply data cleaning, transformation, and enrichment techniques to prepare data for analysis and reporting
Load transformed data into data warehouses, data lakes, or other storage solutions to ensure accessibility and usability
Employ SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SAS and other tools/technologies for data analysis, reporting, performance optimization, and database management
Constantly update knowledge on industry best practices and emerging technologies to provide continuous improvement
Work with a cross-functional team to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Solve complex problems using data-driven techniques
Document all processes, methodologies, and procedures in a clear and concise manner
Handle customer inquiries and provide high quality customer service
Monitor customer accounts and take appropriate action as needed


Requirements


Proven experience with SQL and SAS
Demonstrated understanding and application of Business Logic
Proficient in Database management and Database Object handling
Knowledge in AB Testing
Expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) tools
Ability to create and manage Business Requirement Documents
Strong focus on maintaining Data Quality
Experience in Data Warehousing
Familiarity with ETL - Extract Transform Load processes


Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4429. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

Only job postings for jobs located in Quebec appear in French.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (Remote) - Waterloo Winter 2025
Description:
About Super.com We started Super.com to help maximize lives–both the lives of our customers and the lives of our employees– so that everyone can experience all that life has to offer. For our employees, our promise is that Super.com is more than just a job; it’s an opportunity to unlock one’s potential, where learning is celebrated and impact is realized. We are more than a fast-paced, high-growth tech company; we care about our people and take career progression seriously. This is your career and our aim is to supercharge it through the people, the work, and the programs that fuel who we are. About the Role We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern to join our growing data team for the Summer 2024 term (May-August). As a Data Analyst Intern at Super, you will be responsible for using data to answer strategic questions and support our business strategy and rapid growth. With a strong analytical and data-driven approach you’ll help our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets relating to various performance marketing channels. This is an exciting opportunity that will allow you to run deep-dive analysis, create regression or segmentation models, build dashboards and generate reporting to drive business growth and draw strategic insights from product, user, and operational data. Challenges You’ll Solve


Data-driven Culture: you will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer business questions and drive strategy & decision making
Data Management: you will access, clean and organize raw data in a way that makes sense for you, your team and your stakeholders
Visualizations: you will help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, creating automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams
Hard Questions: You’ll be taking our data and using it to answer business questions, drive strategy and decision making



About You


You can pull, clean and manipulate large sets of complex data to turn them into stories that business stakeholders can understand
You can write SQL queries and perform data analysis with Python and/or R, and know your way around visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI etc)
You are naturally curious and have a solid understanding of common statistical methods and real world applications



We've got you covered


Compensation: we pay our Interns top-of-market
$300 One-time home office set up allowance
$25/Week UberEats allowance on Fridays
$300/Term Learning and Development allowance
$120/ Term Fitness/Wellness allowance
Top Talent: work with the best in the world, including Engineers and Leadership from Google, Facebook, Wish, YouTube, Uber, and more
Build Something Great: most importantly, build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership, have impact, and do great work



We Believe in Equal Opportunity We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If needed, please notify our Talent Acquisition Partner.
Show more

About Super.com We started Super.com to help maximize lives–both the lives of our customers and the lives of our employees– so that everyone can experience all that life has to offer. For our employees, our promise is that Super.com is more than just a job; it’s an opportunity to unlock one’s potential, where learning is celebrated and impact is realized. We are more than a fast-paced, high-growth tech company; we care about our people and take career progression seriously. This is your career and our aim is to supercharge it through the people, the work, and the programs that fuel who we are. About the Role We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern to join our growing data team for the Summer 2024 term (May-August). As a Data Analyst Intern at Super, you will be responsible for using data to answer strategic questions and support our business strategy and rapid growth. With a strong analytical and data-driven approach you’ll help our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets relating to various performance marketing channels. This is an exciting opportunity that will allow you to run deep-dive analysis, create regression or segmentation models, build dashboards and generate reporting to drive business growth and draw strategic insights from product, user, and operational data. Challenges You’ll Solve

  • Data-driven Culture: you will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer business questions and drive strategy & decision making
  • Data Management: you will access, clean and organize raw data in a way that makes sense for you, your team and your stakeholders
  • Visualizations: you will help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, creating automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams
  • Hard Questions: You’ll be taking our data and using it to answer business questions, drive strategy and decision making


About You

  • You can pull, clean and manipulate large sets of complex data to turn them into stories that business stakeholders can understand
  • You can write SQL queries and perform data analysis with Python and/or R, and know your way around visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI etc)
  • You are naturally curious and have a solid understanding of common statistical methods and real world applications


We've got you covered

  • Compensation: we pay our Interns top-of-market
  • $300 One-time home office set up allowance
  • $25/Week UberEats allowance on Fridays
  • $300/Term Learning and Development allowance
  • $120/ Term Fitness/Wellness allowance
  • Top Talent: work with the best in the world, including Engineers and Leadership from Google, Facebook, Wish, YouTube, Uber, and more
  • Build Something Great: most importantly, build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership, have impact, and do great work


We Believe in Equal Opportunity We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If needed, please notify our Talent Acquisition Partner.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a major Oil and Gas company, is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team on a 1-year contract in Calgary. The successful candidate will be responsible for data analysis, supporting business stakeholders to execute data cleansing and conversion, establishing data governance, and gathering reporting requirements. This role will work closely with both business stakeholders and other business and technical analysts on the project team to support the successful implementation and ongoing optimization of the new technology solution.




Key Responsibilities:

Analysis: Analyze data to identify gaps between the current state and required future state. Develop and implement a strategy to remediate these gaps according to project timelines.
Data Migration: Plan and execute the migration of existing data to the new Source to Pay system.
Data Cleansing: Working closely with the Lead BA – Integrations & Data, this will involve mapping data from legacy systems to the new system, cleansing and transforming data as needed and ensuring data integrity during the migration process.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including procurement, finance, and IT, to ensure data accuracy, integrity and readiness.
System Support: Assist in the configuration design of Source to Pay software to meet project requirements.
Training: Provide training and support to end-users on data governance, reporting tools and best practices.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data sources, methodologies, and reporting processes.
Communication and Facilitation: Communicate effectively with the business to understand their data and facilitate discussions to drive necessary decision-making.




Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in a procurement or finance environment.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Power BI) and scripting to execute data transformation. Experience with data integration and ETL processes
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Source to Pay software (e.g. GEP, SAP Ariba, Coupa, Maximo).
Certification in data analysis or related fields.
Knowledge of procurement processes and best practices
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider and our staffing practice has an opening for a Data Analytics Specialist

to place at our client, within Enterprise Telecom Client.




Client: Enterprise Telecom Client

Location: Remote – Canada




Application Process: Please submit your resume via the platform you are using. If you encounter any issues, please email your resume in Word format to John at jpham@apexsystems.com and reference Data Analytics Specialist.




Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analytics Specialist with a strong background in Google Looker. The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of experience in business intelligence (BI) and data analytics, with the ability to quickly address and resolve backlog items. A solid understanding of data building and management is essential.




Key Responsibilities:

Utilize Google Looker to create and maintain data visualizations and dashboards.
Efficiently manage and clear backlog items.
Develop and implement BI solutions to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with data engineers and other stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Build and optimize data models for reporting and analysis.







Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in data analytics and BI.
Proficiency with Google Looker.
Strong understanding of data building and management.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.










EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a fast-growing producer of spirit-based beverages is seeking a data analyst. This candidate will work with the executive team, regional management and sales representatives across Canada preparing detailed analysis of sales, inventory data and other reports as required.

The primary focus of this position is collecting, inputting, and analyzing large volumes of data from various provincial sources, finalizing and distributing reports. This position requires expert level excel skills, data management skills and basic accounting knowledge.

Analysts with previous consumer packaged goods experience or alcohol industry experience are especially sought after for this role.

Responsibilities

Input/Analyze data from multiple sources to complete standardized weekly and monthly sales reports.
Utilize territory sales data and geographic mapping to identify opportunities for sales growth.
Ensure checks and balances across all weekly, bi-weekly and monthly reports for sales data and accounting purposes.
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.

Qualifications & Skill set

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or Mathematics.
5 years experience in an analytics role, prior experience in the alcohol industry is preferred.
Expert level skill in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Access.
Experience analyzing large amounts of confidential data.
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
Critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong verbal and written communication.

Compensation/Benefits

Attractive compensation package.
Comprehensive benefit package.
Bonus opportunity.
3 weeks vacation.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - co-op - Winter 2025
Description:
Change the future with us.

We are passionate about innovations that mean real progress. We are excited about technologies that still need to be developed. What about you? Do you want to use your curiosity, passion, and creativity to make the lives of millions of people easier and better? Join us as a graduate –either by beginning your career with us or through a co-op placement. Whichever path you take, we’re looking forward to seeing your perspective.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens!


Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
Competitive total rewards package
Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
Employee perks and discounts.
Diversity and inclusivity focused.


Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2023, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2024 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens RuggedCom is a leader in the development of rugged communication networking solutions designed for mission critical applications in harsh environments. We are an innovative, rapidly growing company where you'll find an exciting, dynamic work environment and significant opportunity for personal growth.

We are looking for a Data Analyst for our Concord office who would report directly to the Head of Lean & Business Excellence for the Winter Term (Jan - April, 2025); someone with good analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.

Responsibilities:

This role provides an opportunity to gain experience in data analytics and automation. The responsibilities include developing data processing workflows, automation, visualization, and dashboards. You will be

Must be a student pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematic with a focus on data analytics

What will you need to succeed?


Candidates must be either third-year undergraduate students or graduate students pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics with a focus on data analytics.
Having completed at least one co-op term is a strong asset
The ideal candidate will be familiar with or have experience in some or all the following areas:
Python
SQL
Snowflake / dbt
Power BI
Tableau
Interface design concepts such as user experience, information architecture, data modelling, visual design, etc.
Strong communication and written skills
Strong knowledge of MS Excel
Must be available for a 4-month contract starting Jan 2025
Must be available to work on-site at the Concord office an average of 2 days per week.

About Us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

Siemens Canada is a technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare. From more resource-efficient factories, resilient supply chains, and smarter buildings and grids, to cleaner and more comfortable transportation as well as advanced healthcare, the company creates technology with purpose, adding real value for customers since 1912. By combining the real and the digital worlds, Siemens empowers its customers to transform their industries and markets, to transform the everyday for billions of people. Siemens also owns a majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, a globally leading medical technology provider shaping the future of healthcare. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power. As of September 30, 2023, the company has approximately 4,200 employees from coast-to-coast and 33 office and production facilities across Canada. Siemens Canada has a revenue of ~ CAD $2Billion.

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Notice available at www.siemens.ca.

Siemens s’engage à créer un environnement diversifié et est fière d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Sur demande, Siemens Canada prendra des mesures d’accommodement raisonnables pour les personnes handicapées, dans le but de soutenir la participation des candidats dans tous les aspects du processus de recrutement. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour ce poste.

En transmettant des renseignements personnels à Siemens Canada limitée ou à ses sociétés affiliées, à ses fournisseurs de services ou à ses agents, vous nous autorisez à recueillir, à utiliser et à divulguer ces renseignements aux fins prévues dans notre Déclaration de protection de la confidentialité, que vous pouvez consulter au www.siemens.ca.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2013, Organigram first began as a medical cannabis provider. Today, the Company is focused on winning in the Canadian recreational market and dynamically expanding the company’s global footprint and influence.

Organigram has developed a portfolio of adult-use recreational cannabis brands including Edison, Big Bag o’ Buds, SHRED, Monjour, Holy Mountain and Trailblazer. Quebec’s top-selling hash brand Tremblant Cannabis, and artisanal craft brand, Laurentian are also additions to Organigram’s brand portfolio. Organigram operates facilities in three provinces across the country. The primary indoor growing facility is in Moncton, New Brunswick, the premium hash production and premium cultivation facility is in Lac-Supérieur, Quebec and there is a highly automated facility dedicated to edibles manufacturing in Winnipeg, Manitoba. The Company is regulated by Health Canada under the Cannabis Act (Canada) and the Cannabis Regulations (Canada).

Organigram is focused on translating operational excellence into strong financial results and return on investment for shareholders.

Job Summary

As a Commercial Analyst based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making processes. You’ll collaborate closely with the Commercial and IT teams to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights that optimize our recreational cannabis commercial strategies. Your work will directly inform sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain decisions, helping to drive growth and efficiency across the company.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working with data, is eager to develop their skills in a dynamic environment and is excited about making a tangible impact on one of Canada’s leading licensed producer.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze commercial performance data to support decision-making across sales, marketing, commercialization and supply chain teams.
Develop and enhance Power BI dashboards and other analytical tools, transforming data into clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, maintain, and transform data from multiple internal and external sources for analysis.
Create and maintain data models to ensure accurate reporting and forecasting.
Translate business questions into analytical projects and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and solve specific business challenges.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in all analysis and reporting.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve data analytics processes and tools in collaboration with IT and business teams.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within consumer packaged goods (CPG) / fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), or a similar industry.
Strong Power BI skills: Experience with DAX, Power Query, and building dashboards and data visualizations is essential.
Proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced functionalities such as pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in SQL, with experience in writing and optimizing queries.
Exposure to Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data modelling, data warehousing and data management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make actionable recommendations.
Effective communication skills, able to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in the cannabis industry is a strong plus but not required.
Basic knowledge of Python for scripting or automating tasks (preferred).Basic knowledge of Azure Data Factory and data ingestion architecture within an Azure Cloud environment (preferred).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work in a collaborative environment and meet tight deadlines.

Why Join Us?

Growth Opportunity:This role offers the chance to deepen your expertise in analytics and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced industry.
Impact:Your work will directly influence commercial strategies and contribute to the company's success.
Collaborative Environment:Work closely with a passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Show more

  • 2-4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within consumer packaged goods (CPG) / fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), or a similar industry.
  • Strong Power BI skills: Experience with DAX, Power Query, and building dashboards and data visualizations is essential.
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced functionalities such as pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis tools.
  • Proficiency in SQL, with experience in writing and optimizing queries.
  • Exposure to Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data modelling, data warehousing and data management.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make actionable recommendations.
  • Effective communication skills, able to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience in the cannabis industry is a strong plus but not required.
  • Basic knowledge of Python for scripting or automating tasks (preferred).Basic knowledge of Azure Data Factory and data ingestion architecture within an Azure Cloud environment (preferred).
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work in a collaborative environment and meet tight deadlines.

Why Join Us?

  • Growth Opportunity:This role offers the chance to deepen your expertise in analytics and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced industry.
  • Impact:Your work will directly influence commercial strategies and contribute to the company's success.
  • Collaborative Environment:Work closely with a passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6,500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com

Summary

Responsible to support the Construction Program Management Team - Collect, enter, analyze, manipulate, develop customized reports and dashboards, as well as create, maintain, and develop Program Management Tracking Tools, and report on internal and client data. Perform Administrative & Coordination activities to Support the Construction Program Management Team.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Data Management & Analysis


Data Entry - Obtain from various sources such as design drawings, emails, excel documents etc and enter dates, scope, descriptions, costs, quantities etc. into various Program Management Tracking Tools (Master Trackers)
Create complex formulas in Excel to facilitate the management and update of Tracking Tools, Budget Estimates, Spend Projections, RFQ Evaluations, Reporting and other documents as requested.
Identifies opportunities to maximize data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve Program Management Tools.
Identifies and troubleshoots any issues or anomalies related to various Program Management Tracking Tools and Reports.
Responsible for ensuring Program Management Tracking Tools, graphs, pivots and other documents are functional, updated, relevant, customized and available for team use ongoingly.
With inputs from the Program Management Team, defines data requirements and gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.
Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and addresses reporting needs



Administration & Coordination


Performs administrative and coordination activities throughout the Program Life cycle such as requesting and preparing documents for quotes, PO’s, lien searches, Form 9s, invoices etc. Reviews information obtained, identifies issues, proposes solutions, and works with various stakeholders to rectify.
Performs other administrative and coordination activities as requested by the Program Management Team.
Uploads, files, names and organizes documents and information to various company and client systems.
Works with Program Management Team to identify, document and implement process improvements.
Prepare & issue client Project Notifications via email



Knowledge & Skills


College Diploma or University degree in computer science, data engineering, actuarial science or equivalent with a focus on data management and/or Project Management.
2+ years strong Data Processing (alpha and numeric) experience using MS Excel
2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, and data-visualization
Advanced skills in computer technology including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams and Outlook)
Ability to perform ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources
Ability to define data requirements and gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.
Well versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.
Experience in Corporate Real Estate, Construction or Project, Program Management would be considered an asset
Process improvement experience (lean sigma, six sigma even at Greenbelt level) would be beneficial
Experience in Data Governance would be an asset



Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation


NA



BGIS is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome you to apply for a position with us! If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact us at askHR. Upon request for accommodation, we will consult with the applicant in question and provide, or arrange for the provision of, a suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
Who We Are

tsworks Canada, Inc is a technology products and services company based out of Ontario, Canada. We are a subsidiary of The Software Works, Inc, USA. Our mission is to adopt, challenge and set the best practices in Information Technology. At tsworks Canada Inc, we value our employees, take pride in providing best value in customer engagements, and make every effort to be transparent, responsible, and prompt in our commitments.




About This Role

tsworks Canada, Inc is seeking driven and motivated Lead Data Analyst to join its Digital Services Team. You will get hands-on experience with projects employing industry-leading technologies. This position will be a contract to perm, reporting to the Senior Manager and work type will be hybrid with a 2-3 days per week, on-site, in our clients’ locations in Vancouver, BC. This would initially be focused on the operational readiness and maintenance of existing applications and would transition into a build and maintenance role in the long run.




Position: Lead Data Analyst 
Experience: - 10+ Years of hands-on experience in Information Technology 

- 5+ years of experience designing and executing data solutions in Business Intelligence. 

Location: Vancouver, BC 




What skills do we expect from you on Power BI 

Extensive hands-on Power BI visual dashboards, applications, KPI (key performance indicators) scorecards, DAX functions. 
Experience with performance tuning Power BI datasets and reports with Direct and Import mode, Aggregations, Filter Contexts, Partitioning, Row Level Security etc. 
Experience managing and optimizing Power BI Capacities, using Advanced Restful APIs 




What skills do we expect from you in Data and Analytics 

Experience on cloud data ecosystems AWS (Amazon Web Services) Redshift, Azure Synapse, Snowflake or Data Bricks 
Experience writing and tuning performance on complex SQL queries. 
Experience with Star/Snowflake data models 
Experience providing solutions on Retail or Finance data domains. 
Ability to articulate, create, and maintain technical and non-technical documentation. 




In This Role, You Will  

Design and build data applications on public cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or hybrid cloud using a well architected framework. 
Leveraging expertise in data analysis, visualization, and business intelligence to provide valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making within the organization. 
Lead a team of data analysts to execute the data strategy and maintain the ecosystem. 
Regular evaluation of changes in the data industry and adopt the best practices in terms of technology, governance, security, and compliance. 
Optimize cloud data infrastructure costs. 
Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner. 
Develop Power BI visual dashboards, KPI scorecards, and reports utilizing Microsoft technology stack. 
Leverage modern Power BI to extract and manipulate data from a variety of diverse sources. 
Write complex DAX functions in Power BI and Power Pivot. 
Present alternative ways for internal customers to visualize and consume data. 
Understand business questions/pain points and alleviate with supporting data. 
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and adherence to data governance policies. Conduct data quality checks and implement measures to maintain data integrity. 
Research advanced analytic/visualization capabilities to improve customer understanding of data insights. 
Collaborate cross-functionally at various levels and diplomatically influence stakeholders. 
Demonstrate excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. 
Demonstrate the ability to multi-task, deal effectively with ambiguity, change in business requirements, and self-prioritize under pressure. 
Debug data issues and deliver quality results under tight timelines. 

 

Preferences 

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant field. 
Experience in Azure Data Factory or other ETL (Extraction, Transformation, Loading) tools solutioning and development 
Experience working in an agile setting. 
Being self-driven, naturally curious, and able to adapt to a fast-paced work environment. 
Public cloud certifications. 
Excellent Communication Skills 
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Figment is the world’s leading provider of blockchain infrastructure. We provide the most comprehensive staking solution for our over 500+ institutional clients including exchanges, wallets, foundations, custodians, and large token holders to earn rewards on their crypto assets. These clients rely on Figment’s institutional staking service including rewards optimization, rapid API development, rewards reporting, partner integrations, governance, and slashing protection. Figment is backed by industry experts, financial institutions and our global team across twenty three countries. This all leads to our mission to support the adoption, growth and long term success of the Web3 ecosystem.




We are a growth stage technology company – looking for people who are builders and doers. People who are comfortable plotting their course through ambiguity and uncertainty to drive impact and who are excited to work in new ways and empower a generative company culture.




About the Role

We are seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Data Science and Analytics team at Figment. This role is integral to our mission of harnessing data to drive informed decision-making and optimize our business processes. The Senior Data Analyst will work closely with data scientists and other business units to analyze data, create reports, and deliver insights that directly impact our strategy and operations.




We're looking for someone with strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to communicate complex data insights in a clear and actionable manner. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a dynamic environment, dealing with uncertainty, and collaborating across multiple projects.




What you will be doing

Data reporting and pipelining: Develop and maintain dashboards and reporting pipelines. Query databases and process data to support decision-making.
Data Analysis and Visualization: Extract key insights and create visualizations to tell compelling data stories using our tools.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with internal teams like Engineering, Product, Finance, and Customer Success to deliver tailored data solutions.
Understanding Business Needs: Engage with stakeholders to understand Figment's business needs and deliver solutions that elevate Figments operations
Technical Skills: Writing clean, reliable code in the development of scalable solutions.




What you will bring to the team

Analytical Expertise: Strong skills in data analysis and visualization.
Data Tools: DBT, Snowflake Fivetran, AWS, and Monte Carlo.
Technical Skills: Proven experience with SQL, GitHub, Sigma (or equivalent)
Domain expertise: Familiarity of working with Blockchains or in the Web3 space (nice to have)
Communication Skills: Strong ability to convey complex insights clearly and concisely to various stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: Ensure accuracy and reliability in data reporting and analysis.
Adaptability: Thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapting to new challenges as they arise.




This role is perfect for someone passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and eager to make a meaningful impact at Figment. If you thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment and have a knack for turning data into actionable insights, we would love to hear from you.




One of Figment’s core principles is “Making the Invisible Visible” - ensuring transparency and information sharing in all communication. Figment is committed to transparency regarding pay, benefits, and other compensation types for all internal roles as well as all roles being hired for.




Base Salary: The CAD base salary range for this position is CAD $115,000 - $145,000. The US base salary range for this position is USD $115,000 - $145,000. This range reflects base salary only, and does not include additional compensation or benefits. For candidates in other countries, the pay range will be disclosed upon your first interview with Figment (being a globally remote company, the list of salary ranges would simply be too long to note here!). The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum range for a new hire across all Canada or the US. A candidate’s specific pay within the range will be determined by various factors including job-related skills, relevant education, and training.




Benefits: All employees of Figment receive the following competitive benefits. For candidates beyond Canada and the US, benefits will be outlined during your first interview with Figment.

100% remote-first environment, with co-working spaces in our employee “hubs” across the globe for those who enjoy a hybrid model
4 weeks of PTO that kick in day one, with an additional 1 week of flex days
Extended company-paid health benefits that kick in day one
Best in class parental leave and flexible arrangements
A home office stipend to create a space that you enjoy working in
Monthly Wifi reimbursement
A yearly Learning & Development budget
401K (US) or RRSP match (Canada)
Stock Options in the company
Competitive bonus (based on company performance) that is distributed bi-annually - we believe that the company’s success should be shared with our employees often
For roles listed within the Sales Department, there is instead a competitive commissions structure which will be outlined during your first interview with Figment
Annual onsite company gatherings and retreats to inspire team bonding, collaboration, and fun!
A culture of honesty, professionalism and risk taking in a high-growth environment
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.




We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.




To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.




Benefits:




This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:




Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:




Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Previous experience as a Software Developer, Coder, Software Engineer, or Programmer




Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. This job is only available to those in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Those located outside of these countries will not see work or assessments available on our site at this time.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst/Data Engineer
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

• Good years of experience in Data Analyst/Data Engineer.

•Experience in data visualization, data cleaning, data manipulation (extract, transform, load), and tool usage of Tableau, Talend, SSIS.

•Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

•Databases - MS SQL/Oracle/Teradata

•Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data.

•Experience in performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

•Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

•A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.

•Excellent communication abilities in English communication skill, in written and oral.

•Roles & Responsibilities - [Data analysis] Define and specify data analysis target and support modeling / verification / test / application.

•[Data-based decision making] Research and support the insight to support decision making in the areas of business direction/market strategy/product strategy.

•[Verification of decision effects] Support methods to verify the effect of decision on business.

•[Algorithms acidization] Support implementing, evaluating and verifying algorithms for data analysis.

•Excellent communication skills

•Continuous learning attitude

•Team worker

•Meticulous Education bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or related technical skills.




Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.
